alert.note: Alert for Southeast Fayette; Southeast Raleigh (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 12:16AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Raleigh and south central Fayette Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1215 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sandstone, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Meadow Bridge. This includes Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 127 and 137. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia.
